SEARCH
Module JBubbleBobble
Package game.model.powerups

Class PowerupManager

java.lang.Object
game.model.powerups.PowerupManager
public class PowerupManager extends Object
The PowerupManager class is responsible for managing the spawning and removal of power-ups in the game. It uses a PowerupFactory to create power-ups and maintains a list of active power-ups within the game level. The class also handles periodic spawning of new power-ups at set intervals.

  • Constructor Details

    • PowerupManager

      public PowerupManager(char[][] lvlData)
      Constructs a new PowerupManager with the specified level data. This manager initializes the power-up list and factory, and sets up a timer to periodically spawn new power-ups every 30 seconds.
      Parameters:
      lvlData - The level data array representing the game map.

  • Method Details

    • getPowerups

      public List<Powerup> getPowerups()
      Gets the list of active power-ups in the game.
      Returns:
      A list of active power-ups.

    • getPowerupFactory

      public PowerupFactory getPowerupFactory()
      Gets the PowerupFactory instance used by this manager.
      Returns:
      The PowerupFactory instance.

    • createPowerup

      public void createPowerup()
      Creates and adds a new power-up to the game using the PowerupFactory. The created power-up is added to the list of active power-ups.

    • createRandomPowerup

      public void createRandomPowerup()
      Creates and adds a random power-up to the game using the PowerupFactory. The randomly generated power-up is added to the list of active power-ups.

    • isTherePowerup

      public boolean isTherePowerup(int x, int y)
      Checks whether there is a power-up at the specified (x, y) coordinates in the game.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the tile.
      y - The y-coordinate of the tile.
      Returns:
      True if there is a power-up at the given coordinates, false otherwise.

    • addPowerup

      public void addPowerup(Powerup powerup)
      Adds a power-up to the list of active power-ups.
      Parameters:
      powerup - The power-up to be added.

    • removePowerup

      public void removePowerup(Powerup powerup)
      Removes a power-up from the list of active power-ups.
      Parameters:
      powerup - The power-up to be removed.
